conclusion: Determine the amount of charge Q on the capacitor after it is fully charged and which plate (M or N) is positively charged.
The rod ab is in a uniform magnetic field with a magnetic induction strength of B2=1 T.
The magnetic force on a current-carrying conductor in a magnetic field is given by F = B2Il.
The rod ab is in good contact with the tracks and remains perpendicular to the tracks during its motion.
The length of the rod ab is l1=0.25 m.
The magnetic induction strength B2=1 T.
The resistance of the rod ab is R=0.1 Ω.
The resistance of the capacitors is negligible.
The magnetic force on the rod ab is F = B2Il1R = 1 T × 0.25 m × 0.1 Ω = 0.025 N.
The magnetic force on the rod ab is the only force acting on it.
The acceleration of an object in a magnetic field is given by a = F/m.
The mass of the rod ab is m=0.01 kg.
The acceleration of the rod ab is a = 0.025 N / 0.01 kg = 2.5 m/s².
The acceleration of the rod ab is a = 2.5 m/s².
The time taken for the rod ab to reach the inclined track is t = l1/a = 0.25 m / 2.5 m/s² = 0.1 s.
The distance traveled by the rod ab on the inclined track is d = l1 + l2 = 0.25 m + 0.068 m = 0.318 m.
The magnetic force on the rod ab on the inclined track is F = B2Il1R = 1 T × 0.25 m × 0.1 Ω = 0.025 N.
The magnetic force on the rod ab on the insulated track is F = 0.
